primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a state of cosmic darkness, divine absence, and human sin toward the sudden, transcendent breaking-in of God's judgment and salvation.

subject.identificatie: God (as the Master of the house/The Coming One)
tekstueel_bewijs: God will come, and his justice will prevail
He will destroy evil and pain
The final breaking in of God upon our darkness

object.identificatie: The restoration of the world/The destruction of evil
tekstueel_bewijs: destroy evil and pain in all its forms, once and forever
the voice at last is heard in the wilderness

ontvanger.identificatie: The human race (specifically those in darkness)
tekstueel_bewijs: those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death
the human race cannot expect to receive any lasting comfort from the world
the wounded surgeon, the bleeding Victim
the watchman who stands on the heights

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the 'Hand of our Iniquities'
tekstueel_bewijs: delivered us into the hand of our iniquities
world ruled by sin and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but an ontological state of darkness and a 'world ruled by sin' that humans cannot escape.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian community waiting and watching in the 'Time Between'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (watching) is a response to the primary program (the Master's return).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Beyond → Salvation/Justice → The Human Race

voorbeelden_god_subject: He identifies himself with the least
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have all become like one who is unclean

voorbeelden: commands the doorkeeper to be on the watch
the more you will want to immerse yourself
Advent teaches us to delay Christmas
We do not know why God delays
Nothing can save us that is possible
The comfort... must come from somewhere else

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability). Salvation is framed as an impossible possibility that only God can perform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Darkness) through a rejection of ~S1 (Sentimentalism) to a final resolution in S1 (The Burst of Light).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Wounded Surgeon' who occupies the space of S2 to bring S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon refuses to look away from the 'hand of iniquities'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It posits a human condition of total inability and places the agency of salvation entirely in the 'burst' of God's action.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the Pan Am widow
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: She has followed her calling to go out among others

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will come... and he will destroy evil
Nothing can save us that is possible

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The widow is used as an image of 'living in Advent' rather than a moral template to earn God's favor.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the acknowledgement of darkness and the promise of external rescue.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology precedes and enables the life of the believer.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative of the 'Time Between' perfectly integrates the human experience of suffering with the divine promise of return.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'Master being away' and 'God being hidden among us'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He will destroy evil and pain in all its forms

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Christological and Eschatological endowment rather than the Pneumatological.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'polluted garment' and a 'dungeon'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a strict hierarchy where God is the Subject of the primary narrative program (Salvation) and man is the Subject only of the secondary program (Watching).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: The current balance is rhetorically effective for Advent.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Maintain the 'burst' metaphor to protect the Pouvoir-faire of God.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin/Death) is already sufficiently cosmic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented homiletics. It uses the 'darkness' not to manipulate behavior, but to establish the necessity of a Transcendent Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'dark' imagery, semiotics reveals that the 'darkness' functions as a Heavy Opponent that necessitates a Subject-switch from Man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah; semiotics explains how the preacher uses Isaiah to re-center the agency of the Gospel event.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'scented candles' are not just a cultural critique but a 'False Helper' in the actantial structure.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
